intro: Pisum granulatum, commonly known as the granulated pea, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family. It is characterized by its distinctive granulated or rough texture on the pod and seeds. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source in certain regions.
